intro: Dissochaeta bracteata, commonly known as the bract-leaved dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that often have a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in small inflorescences. Dissochaeta bracteata is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
